Room.Name: a dirt path
Room.Description: You stand in the middle of a faint dirt path. This path is well kept but appears as if it is very seldom used. To the north you can make out a small stone building behind a great tree, the thundering sounds of a hammer striking an anvil can be heard coming from the building.

Room.Name: a dirt path
Room.Description: You stand in the middle of a faint dirt path. This path is well kept but appears as if it is very seldom used. To the north you can make out a small stone building behind a great tree, the thundering sounds of a hammer striking an anvil can be heard coming from the building.

Room.Name: a dirt path
Room.Description: You are still on the path and the building and tree are now closer and still to the north. Ahead of you the path seems to bend around the tree on its way towards the small building. The air around you seems to be getting hotter as you near the building and the sound of the hammer has grown to a near deafening volume. To the South you can make out the begining of the trail.

Room.Name: a bend in the dirt path
Room.Description: Right before the path reaches the giant tree it begins to bend around it. The tree now obscures your view of the small building but the din of the hammer has reached unbearable levels and the air here is considerable warmer then that at the begining of the path. the path veers to the east to go around the giant tree.

Room.Name: a path around a giant tree
Room.Description: You can again make out the building to the north and you are close enough to make out the individual stone blocks which make it up. To the west is the massive tree and looking up you cannot make out the top as it reaches into the heavens. at the base of the tree a dwarf sits with a mug of ale in his hand and greets you as you pass. the path continues to the north towards the house and to the west around the tree.

ExtraDescription.Description: This tree seems to be as ancient as the ground upon which it stands. The tree itself is a redish brown in color and its base must be at least 40 feet thick. Its top reaches towards the heavens and some mos grows upon its base.

Room.Name: a path around a giant tree
Room.Description: You are now much closer to the building and nearly past the tree. The heat emmitted from the building is intense and the ringing of the hammer is even more prevalent. Smoke pours from a small chimny above the building into the sky creating a small pillar of smoke until it disperses into the air. The Tree is still to your West and the trail goes on to the north towards the building and back to the south where it disapears behind the tree.

ExtraDescription.Description: This tree seems to be as ancient as the ground upon which it stands. The tree itself is a redish brown in color and its base must be at least 40 feet thick. Its top reaches towards the heavens and some mos grows upon its base.

Room.Name: before the building
Room.Description: You stand before the building in a small dusty courtyard. You can now here the sounds of many hammers striking anvils and here the shouts of men from within the building. The building itself appears to be made of a pale grey stone and its door is made of a reddish wood. In all the building appears to be a very plain forge. On the door of the forge an image depicting a large two headed hammer has been engraved in gold, silver, steel, iron, and wood.

ExtraDescription.Description: This door is about 5 feet wide and is bordered by grey stone walls. The door itself is made out of a redish wood and there is an image on it of a large two-headed hammer. You suddenly notice that there is no door knob on the door.

Embalazoned on the door is a depiction of a large two-headed hammer. The hammer is large and most of it has been created from iron set into the wood of the door. On one jead of the hammer a sunburst is depicted while on the other a moon has been made. The hammer looks almost real as if it was going to jump out of the door into your hands.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: You stand just within the red door. Before you sprawls a massive forge filled with all sorts of creatures all of them working on one thing or another. The size of this forge sees immpossible given the size of the building but none of the other people notice. Standing by the door is an old dwarf who is leaning on a long staff. To the north a drowish engraver is working, to the West you can make out a human blacksmith and to the East is a small empty workbench for new aprentices.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: A drowish engraver sits on a wooden bench with a hammer and chisle in hand. He is currently putting the finishing touches on a engraving on a piece of armor. On the bench is an assortment of hammers and chisles and other tools which are used by an engraver. To the west a large storm giant is making weapons, to the east a dwarf is making iron and steel, and to the south is the door to the forge. To the east an elvish armorer is making an ornate breastplate.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: A storm giant stands here beating a massive piece of metal with a giant hammer. The metal seems to resemble the blade of an axe but it is too difficult to tell because he has just started. To the east is a drowish engraver and towards the north a small gnome seems to be working on some sort of contraption. To the south you see a human blacksmith working on a horseshoe.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: A tall human male stands beside an anvil shaping a horseshoe from an iron rod. His workspace is not filled with weapons and armor but rather with ladles and pots and horseshoes. To the north is a storm giant and to the east is the door to the forge.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: This is by far the most unorganized of all the workbenches. This is where the gnomish tinker has his workspace. Cracked pots, bent swords, and dented armor all lay around waiting to be mended, while other objects seem to have strange gears and rods hanging out of them. The gnome is currently trying to attach a spring to a pot for some reason.To the south a large storm giant is making weapons and to the east is the workspace of the Creator.

Room.Name: The Workbench of The Creator
Room.Description: You stand within the workspace of the great Creator. A massive anvil stands in the center of this area and along the northern wall is a massive fire. All sorts of tools line the walls and benches and a large pile of coal is by the fire. To the west is the workbench of a gnomish tinker and to the east is a deserted workbench. To the south a drowish engraver is practicing his trade.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: This workspace is empty and the dwaren master stonecutter is absent. All about this workspace are statues of marble, granite, and other various minereals. Among the statues and figurines an occasional weapon or piece of armor cut from stone can be seen. To the west is the workbench of the creator. to the south is an elvish armorer.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: A short elf uses a hammer to gild an ornate breastplate from gold and silver. Other pieces of armor line this workspace, all of excellent quality and elegance. To the north and south are empty workspaces and to the west is a drowish engraver. Along the east wall is a door to the storage space where raw materials are kept for use.

Room.Name: inside the forge
Room.Description: Here is a small workspace designed for new aprentices. It is stocked with lots of raw materials and tools. A large anvil sits in the middle of it waiting to be used and a small fire burns in the fire along the east wall. To the north an elf is making armor, to the west is the entrance to the forge.

Room.Name: a storage closet
Room.Description: You stand inside the storage closet. Piles of raw materials neatly line the walls and shelves of this room waiting to be used. The door back to the forge is to the west. along the opposite wall is hung a pleOrthos of spare tools in the case that anyone breaks their own.

Room.Name: standing inside the flame
Room.Description: You stand within a fire but it does not singe your flesh, instead your soul feels uplifted and cleansed by this experience. You slowly feel yourself become one with the flame.
